conclusion: To find the current I of the constant current source.
The velocity-time graph shows that the mover accelerates from rest to v1 = 80 m/s in t1 = 1.5 s.
The acceleration a is given by a = v1/t1 = 80 m/s / 1.5 s = 53.3 m/s^2.
The magnetic force FB is given by FB = n * B * l * I.
Where n = 100, B = 0.1 T, l = 1 m.
Use Newton's second law for the combined mass.
The net force on the system is F_net = (M + m) * a.
Given M = 10 kg (mass of the aircraft) and m = 5 kg (mass of the mover and coil).
Equate the magnetic force to the net force: n * B * l * I = 800 N.
Plugging in the values: 100 * 0.1 T * 1 m * I = 800 N.
The current I of the constant current source is 80 A.
